revised_title: Observations on the Permanent Spot in Jupiter and a Dispute over Optic Glasses
tldr: This article discusses the discovery of the permanent spot on Jupiter and a dispute between two artists, Eustachio de Divinis and P. Gotignies, over the observation and technology of optic glasses. It also mentions that the spot was observed in England before any news of its discovery. Divinis claims to have found a way to determine the quality of an object glass just by looking at it, which would be useful for identifying good telescopes before they are completed.
